article.title: "Something Went Wrong" Error Message When Logging In
article.body:
If you are an iOS user receiving an error message that says "Something Went Wrong" when attempting to log in to the Strava app, this issue may be related to your specific Apple device and email token. Please note that this issue can still occur for athletes who can log in to the Strava website but receive an error message on their iPhone App.

Unfortunately, we cannot fix this directly from our end. As a workaround, you should be able to access your account on the mobile app via Google Authentication instead of the traditional email and password. Please follow these steps to ensure your Google account is connected to Strava:

    • Open Strava on your PC, ensure you are logged in, and open this page: https://www.strava.com/settings/profile
    • Scroll until you see "Social Connections" on the right side of the screen.
    • Select the option to “Connect with Google.” Follow the prompts to set up that authorization. You will need to create a Gmail account if you do not already have one ready to use.​

Once you have successfully connected Strava to your Google account, open the mobile app and use the "Continue with Google" button on the login screen. Enter the Gmail address associated with your Strava account and follow the authorization prompts.

Please contact our support team if you continue to experience issues logging into your account and provide information to help verify your account.
